meanings.definition: To shine brighter than something else.
meanings.sent1: The sun can outsparkle the stars at night.
meanings.sent2: Her smile always seems to outsparkle the room.
meanings.sent3: The little firefly tried to outsparkle the streetlights.
meanings.sent4: The diamond outsparkled all the other gems in the display.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks outsparkled the moon in the sky.

meanings.definition: To surpass in brilliance or attractiveness.
meanings.sent1: The colorful flowers outsparkle the plain ones.
meanings.sent2: Her artwork never fails to outsparkle the rest.
meanings.sent3: The peacock tried to outsparkle the other birds with its feathers.
meanings.sent4: Her performance on stage outsparkled all the others.
meanings.sent5: The new dress outsparkled all the others at the party.
